name: Cistus canadensis
Relationship: Antidotes: RHUS; SEPIA. Compare: CONIUM; CARBO; CALC; ARG. N.
Modalities: Worse: slightest exposure to cold air; mental exertion

Respiratory: Asthmatic after lying down , preceded by formication
Stomach: Cool feeling in stomach before and after eating
Stool: Diarrhoea from coffee and fruit, thin, yellow, urgent; worse in morning
Chest: The neck is studded with tumors
Face: Itching, burning, and crusts on right zygoma
Skin: Itching of swollen hands and arms; general itching which prevents sleep
Skin of hands hard, thick, dry, fissured; deep cracks
Throat: Spongy feeling; very dry and cold air passing over parts causes pain
Breath, tongue, and throat feel cold
Head drawn to one side by swellings in neck
Sore throat from inhaling the least cold air
A small, dry spot in throat; must sip water frequently
Swelling and suppuration of glands of throat
Mouth: Mouth feels cold; putrid, impure breath
Extremities: Tips of fingers sensitive to cold
Syphilitic ulcers on lower limbs, with hard swelling around
Sleep: Cannot sleep from coldness in throat
Ears: Tetter on and around ears, extending to external meatus

details: A deep-acting anti-psoric remedy, with marked action in glandular affections, herpetic eruptions, chronic swellings, when patient is EXTREMELY SENSITIVE TO COLD. SENSATION OF COLDNESS IN VARIOUS PARTS. Scrofulous ophthalmia. Poisoned wounds, bites, phagedenic ulcers. MALIGNANT DISEASE OF THE GLANDS OF THE NECK. Cistus has affinity for nasopharynx; aborts colds that center in posterior nose. Sniffling.
dosage: First to thirtieth attenuation. Locally as a wash to arrest fetid discharges.
